review_text:
I understand the 5 star reviews - John and Rebecca are nice people & John goes out of his way to be available for questions. But if someone had posted an honest review, I would never have made reservations at Corriedale Farm - pictures shown on their page are very outdated/inaccurate and not at all what I saw. I cannot speak for the separate guest house (which was immaculate on the outside), but the farmhouse was not clean. The shared kitchen was rife with gnats including dead ones all over the window sill, no towels/paper towels to clean/dry dishes with (I had to go into their pantry for them), dirty counters. Not anywhere I would cook. The bedrooms downstairs, well, let’s just say the cleaning person changed the sheets but not mattress cover, bedspread or covered bed pillows (yuck). I’m not even sure she changed the sheets as I went to remove the bed cover, only to have a drinks coaster pop up, caught somewhere in the bedspread! I had flies and gnats in my room, a cockroach outside my door in the morning and ants! The bathroom had visible long dark hairs stuck to a shelf, worn towels and a shower that backed up 2” within minutes (gross). The bathrooms were not clean.
The walkout from my room that I was looking forward to relaxing on was massively overgrown by weeds, with dirty chairs made worse by a clean or dirty threadbare bath rug hanging over one. There were large pieces of furniture glass dumped all over the property for some reason. The fire pit area, completely misrepresented on their site, had broken chairs, wheelbarrows filled with mosquito infested stagnant water (which I tipped/drained), BROKEN GLASS (I had my dog with me!) and weeds upon weeds! I actually weeded the area, removed hazardous pieces of metal, curled up the hose, and cleaned up the grill tools laying all over the ground just so I could relax there.
I left a day early for a family issue, but truthfully, I could have stayed the last night of my reservation. I was just so uncomfortable there. I’m not squeamish, but when you pay $80 a night to stay somewhere it should be clean. Period. For John to say he doesn’t believe in needing to be “Covid clean” okay, I can get that -- but this house needed a good scrubbing from top to bottom, outside and inside.
I could have had a similar farm/dog-friendly experience at other places that were much closer to home but I was duped by outdated pictures and spent money I don’t really have (celebrating the end of months of cancer treatment) at Corriedale Farm. I wanted to celebrate surviving cancer in a clean, beautiful place and instead was uncomfortable, unsettled, and ultimately unhappy. Even thinking about it now makes me so upset. My first vacation in a year should have been better, needed to be better, but now the vacation is over, the money's gone and the tranquil rest I so desperately needed didn’t happen.
Did I say anything to my hosts? No, but despite confirming twice that I was arriving at 3 pm (normal check-in time), the cleaning person (Pattie) had not yet arrived and I was left to sit outside for more than an hour while she “cleaned.” John himself spoke to his lax ideas about cleaning night one, so I didn’t feel bringing it up would help. And let’s face it...it’s difficult because this is their home and you have a room in it (versus say a guest house). I would have been commenting on their cleanliness and I didn’t feel comfortable doing that. I should have, but I don’t think it would have changed anything.
Nice people but clearly they need help maintaining the rental rooms and shared spaces. I am sorry I stayed there, as I’m sure they will be when they read this review.
